description:
It isn't only demons who can gain power from the Shikon jewel... and sometimes, those that weren't demons can become even worse, as Kagome, Inu-Yasha, and their companions find out when they fall afoul of the hideous "Peach Man."

Then, it seems there are even more mysteries of the jewel to be uncovered, as we meet a village of warriors dedicated to fighting the demons the jewel creates!

Chapter Titles

  • Scroll One: The Fruits of Evil
  • Scroll Two: The Secret Garden
  • Scroll Three: Stomach Trouble
  • Scroll Four: The Night Kitchen
  • Scroll Five: Peach Man's Nectar
  • Scroll Six: The Enchanted Bow
  • Scroll Seven: The Soul of a Demon
  • Scroll Eight: The Exterminators
  • Scroll Nine: The Ambush
  • Scroll Ten: Within the Fort
name: Building a Better Trap

description:
Trained from birth to kill demons, the warrior-maiden Sango is turned against Inu-Yasha by Naraku, the crafty demon whose manipulations have tormented the heroic group time and time again. Will Sango finally realize that Naraku is her true enemy, or will Inu-Yasha pay the ultimate price at the hands of this expert demon hunter?

A warrior trained from birth to kill demons, Sango is rescued from death and turned against Inu-Yasha by Naraku, the crafty demon whose manipulations have tormented the heroic group time and tie again. Will Sango finally realize just who her true enemy is, or will Inu-Yasha pay the ultimate price at the hands of this expert demon hunter?

Chapter Titles

  • Scroll One: The Mummy
  • Scroll Two: Vengeance
  • Scroll Three: Suspicious
  • Scroll Four: Strategies
  • Scroll Five: Golem
  • Scroll Six: The Birth of the Jewel
  • Scroll Seven: The Water God
  • Scroll Eight: The Holy Relic
  • Scroll Nine: The God's Truth
  • Scroll Ten: The True God
name: A Warrior's Code

description:
The monk Miroku has carried his curse since birth, passed down from his father. Now that the curse is threatening to kill him, he must decide whether to accept help or take the danger into death with him. Then, Sango is offered a terrible deal by Naraku--her brother's life for Inu-Yasha's sword!

Miroku has carried a curse since birth, passed down from his father - a hellhole in his hand, cut by a demon. That curse is now threatening to kill him, and he's forced to seek help from his mentor, a wise old priest with a rare knowledge of healing... but that priest may not be what he seems.

Finally, Sango faces her greatest test - her resurrected younger brother, who has been brought back to life by her greatest enemy!

Chapter Titles

  • Scroll One: The Typhoon
  • Scroll Two: The Slaying of the Snake
  • Scroll Three: The Wound and the Wind
  • Scroll Four: The Temple of Innocence
  • Scroll Five: To the Rescue
  • Scroll Six: Urn Grubs
  • Scroll Seven: The Span of Life
  • Scroll Eight: Kohaku
  • Scroll Nine: New Life
  • Scroll Ten: Sango's Betrayal
name: Scars of the Past

description:
The gang encounters a half-demon living peacefully with his mother, and must fight to defend the poor creature from accusations of murder for a number of mysterious deaths in a nearby village. Then, the demon Naraku's web of deceit tightens... first around Sango, forced to choose between her loyalty to her friends and her love for her brother...

Then, the resurrected priestess Kikyo, held prisoner in Naraku's castle. How can Inu-Yasha and his company escape from the demon's deadly traps while fighting their own emotions as well?

Chapter Titles

  • Scroll One: Naraku's Castle
  • Scroll Two: The Vapors
  • Scroll Three: Purification
  • Scroll Four: The Earth Boy
  • Scroll Five: The Raid
  • Scroll Six: The Half-Breed's Heart
  • Scroll Seven: The Belonging Place
  • Scroll Eight: The Cave of Evil
  • Scroll Nine: Fulfillment
  • Scroll Ten: Poison
name: Trials and Traps

description:
Inu-Yasha fights to protect Kikyo and Kagome from the demon pit, whose denizens have produced powerful monsters. Just as victory is near, Kikyo allows one demon to escape and inhabit Naraku. Then Totosai comes to Inu-Yasha seeking protection from Seshomaru, who has stolen one of the swordmaster's blades - a sword that gives life instead of taking it.

Chapter Titles

  • Scroll One: Kikyo's Arrow
  • Scroll Two: Where is the Imp?
  • Scroll Three: Kikyo Captured
  • Scroll Four: Death by Illusion
  • Scroll Five: Death Wish
  • Scroll Six: Naraku's True Form
  • Scroll Seven: Toto-Sai, The Swordsmith
  • Scroll Eight: Tenseiga
  • Scroll Nine: Scar of the Wind
  • Scroll Ten: The Invisible Path
name: The Mind's Eye

description: BIRDS OF PREY's Power Girl teams with the mysterious Emerald Knight to search for the missing JLA! Where have the World's Greatest Super-Heroes gone? And what terrible secret did they learn? Power Girl and a GL who protected Earth centuries ago embark on a suicide mission to rescue the captured heroes.
name: Deep Down Below the Surface

description:
After the battle with his half-brother Inu-Yasha, Seshomaru lies wounded and receives aid from a girl. But tragedy strikes when wolf-warrior Kouga attacks the girl's village, killing her and everyone else. Will Seshomaru, with his life-giving sword, take pity on the girl who nursed him back to health? It all comes down to a brutal showdown between Kouga and Inu-Yasha. The setting: the cliffs of a mountain infested with demons!

Chapter Titles

  • Scroll One: The True Master
  • Scroll Two: Wolves
  • Scroll Three: The Maiden's Life
  • Scroll Four: Koga
  • Scroll Five: Hostage
  • Scroll Six: The Wolves Cave
  • Scroll Seven: The Harpies
  • Scroll Eight: The Three-Way Battle
  • Scroll Nine: The Stronger Man
  • Scroll Ten: Why She Let Him Go
name: Gray Areas

description:
The aftermath of a vicous argument sees Kagome stomping back to the present day, and Inu-Yasha sulking in the past. One or the other has to apologize--but which one is more stubborn? Then, Naraku's most enigmatic pawn yet enters the battle--Kagura, a beautiful woman with the power to control the dead!

Inu-Yasha and Kagome have a falling out over the wolf-demon Kouga... has Kagome really transferred her affections? Regardless of her feelings, it's a touchy enough subject for Kagome to leave the past for the present. Now if Inu-Yasha wants her back, he'll have to bear the unbearable... and apologize... But since when does Inu-Yasha apologize for anything?! And what does it matter anyway? They're not a couple... or are they?

Chapter Titles

  • Scroll One: Dueling Emotions
  • Scroll Two: The Other Side of the Well
  • Scroll Three: The Chase
  • Scroll Four: Corpse Dance
  • Scroll Five: Kagura
  • Scroll Six: Wind Witch
  • Scroll Seven: The Spider On Her Back
  • Scroll Eight: Mystery of the Wind Witch
  • Scroll Nine: Koharu
  • Scroll Ten: Kanna
name: Feminine Wiles

description:
Inu-Yasha's nemesis, the demon Naraku, has gained the ability to create demonic offspring, a new power gained from a large fragment of the Shikon Jewel. This fragment was given to the demon by Kikyo, the priestess whose duty was once to guard the jewel from demons. But why would she give it to her greatest enemy...?

Naraku's weapon against Inu-Yasha is a beautiful wind-witch named Kagura, who not only has incredible powers but also seems to be an extension of the enigmatic Naraku himself. Soon, Kanna and Inu-Yasha's brother Sesshomaru join the fray, with shocking consequences.

Chapter Titles

  • Scroll One: The Human Shield
  • Scroll Two: Turn-Around
  • Scroll Three: The Light of the Shikon
  • Scroll Four: The Arrow Released
  • Scroll Five: Kikyo's Plan
  • Scroll Six: The Third Demon
  • Scroll Seven: The Mind-Reader
  • Scroll Eight: Demon Blood
  • Scroll Nine: True Nature
  • Scroll Ten: The Ogre's Sword
name: Mirror Image

description:
Sesshomaru's quest to gain a new blade from an evil swordsmith has backfires - the vengeful soul of Goshinki, another of Naraku's demonic "offspring," lives on in the blade. Can Inu-Yasha with his newly restored Tetsusaiga take on this new evil sword? Or will he have to learn how to better use the power of his father's great fang?

Then, Kagura approaches Sesshomaru with the goal of convincing him to kill Naraku!

Chapter Titles

  • Scroll One: Tokijin
  • Scroll Two: Tetsusaiga Reborn
  • Scroll Three: Tokijin's Choice
  • Scroll Four: The Scent of Blood
  • Scroll Five: True Strength
  • Scroll Six: The Fourth One
  • Scroll Seven: Juromaru, The Beast Boy
  • Scroll Eight: Without Shields
  • Scroll Nine: Shadow Boy
  • Scroll Ten: Two Against Two
name: A Savage Cut

description:
Thanks to the lingering lust of the weak human form who originally gave life to the demon Naraku, the evil mastermind is unable to kill the priestess Kikyo - a fact she taunts the demon with. Furious, Naraku intends to prove her wrong, and sends a Giant Soul Skimmer to destroy her!

Inu-Yasha comes to her rescue... and Kagome returns from her own era just in time to see Inu-Yasha and Kikyo embrace. Can such a many-sided love triangle have a happy ending?

Chapter Titles

  • Scroll One: The Enemy in the Earth
  • Scroll Two: Pulverize
  • Scroll Three: Kikyo's Crisis
  • Scroll Four: Onigumo's Heart
  • Scroll Five: Jealousy
  • Scroll Six: The Soul Shield
  • Scroll Seven: Where They First Met
  • Scroll Eight: Kagome's Heart
  • Scroll Nine: The Castle's Ghost
  • Scroll Ten: Kohaku's Memory
name: Love and Lust

description:
Sango's brother Kohaku has been freed of Naraku's spell--or has he?! With Kagome's life in danger, Inu-Yasha and the others set out after her. Who is more to blame for the deception? Naraku for causing it, or Inu-Yasha for believing it? If Kohaku is truly to become himself again, first he must face the horror he himself has committed. But can Sango ever forgive the death of their parents at her little brother's hand...?

Thanks to the lingering lust of the weak human form who originally gave life to the demon Naraku, the evil mastermind is unable to kill the priestess Kikyo - a fact she taunts the demon with. Furious, Naraku intends to prove her wrong, and sends a Giant Soul Skimmer to destroy her!

Inu-Yasha comes to her rescue... and Kagome returns from her own era just in time to see Inu-Yasha and Kikyo embrace. Can such a many-sided love triangle have a happy ending?

Chapter Titles

  • Scroll One: Suspicion
  • Scroll Two: The Erased Heart
  • Scroll Three: Sango's Decision
  • Scroll Four: The Face That Wouldn't Disappear
  • Scroll Five: Secret of the Transformation
  • Scroll Six: The Venomous Cocoon
  • Scroll Seven: Rampage
  • Scroll Eight: The Lost Soul
  • Scroll Nine: Blood Soaked In
  • Scroll Ten: The Talon Shield
name: Target: Kagome!

description: The super-swift GL called Green Lightning joins forces with DC's premier spacefaring hero! The duo journeys to the planet Rann to try and save Adam Strange's adopted people. But the devastation left in the wake of the alien threat's passing hides a terrible secret that threatens everything Adam and the Emerald Speedster are trying to accomplish.
name: We Rann All Night

description:
As Inu-Yasha battles one enemy after another, Kagome wages a battle of her own against the wicked priestess Tsubaki, Kagura's (and thus Naraku's) latest pawn. With no visible external wounds, Kagome is slowly being poisoned by a corrupted, blackened shard of the Shikon Jewel, one that would put her under Kagura's control. Will Kagome's will stand firm against the lure of turning against Inu-Yasha?

Chapter Titles

  • Scroll One: The Dragon-Bone Spirit
  • Scroll Two: Talons and Blade
  • Scroll Three: The New Tetsusaiga
  • Scroll Four: The Crushing Stream
  • Scroll Five: Tsubaki, The Black Priestess
  • Scroll Six: The Curse
  • Scroll Seven: The Arrow's Mark
  • Scroll Eight: Tsubaki's Shrine
  • Scroll Nine: The Shikigami
  • Scroll Ten: The Curse Reflected
name: Shards of Evil?

description: SECRET INVASION strikes Thunderbolts Mountain as Captain Marvel attacks! But when you're dealing with the Thunderbolts, it's never quite clear who's the villain and who's the hero...Also, another unexpected visitor shows up, threatening to tear the T-Bolts apart from within! Can Norman Osborn hold his team of damaged psyches and tortured souls together, or is this the end of the Thunderbolts as we know them?
name: Running the Asylum, Pt. 1

description:
1. Cover by Bob Oksner.
  2. "Murder in Metropolis!" written by John Albano, penciled by Mike Sekowski, inked by Mike Esposito. (Jimmy Olsen, Superman, Lois Lane, Perry White, Intergang) Jimmy is on Inter-Gang's hit list!
  3. "I Am... The Gun!" written by Unknown, penciled by and inked by Sal Amendola.
  4. "And Time Goes On..." written by Steve Skeates, penciled by Quico Redondo and inked by Jun LoFamia.
name: Murder in Metropolis! / I Am... The Gun! / And Time Goes On...

description:
1. The Forging of Young Batman! (Superboy, Batman, Ma and Pa Kent / written by Leo Dorfman)

2. Album of Unsung Heroes! (written by Leo Dorfman)

3. The Amazing Tots of Smallville! (Superbaby, Ma and Pa Kent, Lana and Lewis Lang, Pete Ross, Lex Luthor / written by Jerry Siegel : reprinted from: Superboy #102)

An "untold tale of Superboy," this is the "youngest" appearance of Lana, Lex, Lewis and Pete.
name: The Forging of Young Batman! ; Album of Unsung Heroes ; The Amazing Tots of Smallville!

description:
Based on the best-selling game, Devil May Cry 3 is an action-packed adventure, pitting good against evil... and brother against brother!

Dante is a demon slayer and bounty hunter with a demon heritage of his own that haunts his past. He's currently unemployed - and bored to death. Opportunity knocks in the form of a missing-child case, which his friend and manager, Enzo, offers him. But a four-million-dollar reward, an unexpected demon attack and a little girl named Alice all conspire to send Dante through the looking glass on a nightmarish adventure beyond his wildest imagination.

Story and art by Chayamachi Suguro.
name: Code 1: Dante

description:
Vergil and Dante are twins birthed from mixed human and demon blood. Vergil, the elder twin, seeks power to surpass his father's power. The younger twin, Dante finds no reason to seek this power. Vergil in his search realizes great power can be achieved by assembling seven names. When the most danegrous twins reunite, the gates to the demon world will open.

Story and art by Suguro Chayamachi.
name: Code 2: Vergil

description: SPIDER-MAN VERSUS CAPTAIN AMERICA IN THE JUNGLES OF THE SAVAGE LAND! But who is who and what is what?? At least one of these people isn't who they say they are. Plus a huge chapter in the Secret Invasion story as more information as to how the Skrulls set their major plans in motion is revealed... Guest-starring Ka-Zar and Shanna and featuring spectacular artwork from rising star Billy Tan.
name: [untitled]

description:
Overview:

In this fatal first issue by the creative team of Steve Niles (30 Days of NightSIMON DARK) and Kelley Jones (BATMAN: RED RAIN), Batman will come face-to-face with the Master of Fear himself but just what is the Scarecrow after? And what does it have to do with the Axeman? Could it be some elaborate scheme to trap the Bat? Be here at the beginning and beware!
name: Scarecrow Escapes Asylum

description: SPOILER
name: Swamp of Shadows

description: The siege of Nanda Parbat continues as Green Arrow and Deadman get some much-needed assistance from Nightwing and Hawkman!
name: Wings and Arrows

description:
The Piraka have triumphed on Voya Nui! Only six Matoran remain free to challenge the invaders. All other beings foolish enough to fight back have been defeated.
The way seems clear for the Piraka to achieve their goal: finding and stealing the powerful Mask of Life. Universal disaster is only days away. But the Piraka are unaware of the presence of a mysterious being whose life is dedicated to protecting the mask.
And what the Piraka don't know may destroy them...
-inside description
name: Vengeance of Axonn

description:
Overview:

The penultimate chapter of Raven's first miniseries has the gothic Titan battling for her own sanity as the forces of the Medusa Mask are unleashed. How long can Raven keep her darker self in check?
name: Pieces of the Puzzle

description: Tim's on the run and, with Batman's life at stake, he can't afford to make one misstep. Don't miss Part 1 of a shocking 2-part story that will irrevocably change Tim Drake's present as Robinand his hard-won future as Batman.
name: Scattered Pieces

description: Where's Delgado? After the shooting, he hasn't made a public appearance, but only issued statements through proxies. Is he even alive? With the election right around the corner, everyone's in a frenzy.
name: Blood in the Game, 5 of 6

description: Xanadu sees her sister ( Morgana)start a war so her son can rule Camelot. Morgana tells Xanadu to join her and Xanadu declines. She also tells her Merlin summoned a demon and left Camelot but it was to late. She then teleports to her forest to see Etrigan transforming back to his human form. Stranger then comes to her and tells her she needs to disempower Merlin who is going to want to live forever and is going to mess up future events. He tells her that he is going to want her and him to go far away and she must not listen to him. When she goes into her hut she sees Merlin looking through her things and he tells Xanadu they need to go and don't forget her life potion. She goes into the forest to make a potion and she mesmerize Merlin. She brings him into a forest where vines wrap him up and kill him, she then notices her connection to the forest has been cut.
name: Untitled

description:
CHAPTER 3

The clash between the barbarians and the Abellican missionaries rages on until Andacanavar and Moira enter the fray. With a lightning quick strike, and a burst of magical flames the pair subdue the great chieftain, and his monk adversaries. By summoning the demon they had destroyed earlier using Andacanavar's oracle glass and some gemstone magic, they extract the information they need from the fiend to prove to the barbarians that the frost giants were behind the attack on the carriage and the kidnapping of Byggvir's daughter. Finally convinced Byggvir and his barbarians join with Andacanavar and the Abellicans to track down the frost giants responsible for taking Elene.

After an unpleasant exchange with Abbot Greene, Moira takes off on her own to hunt and to clear her head. She is surprised by an ancient guardian of the old ones, a.k.a. a monster, and suddenly finds herself in a dangerous situation. Fortunately Grave Mungo happens to be nearby, and pulls her up from a certain death. Once on solid footing again, Moira unleashes a powerful blast on the creature killing it instantly. Grave accompanies Moira back to camp, during a conversation between the two we get a look into Grave Mungo's home life and the painful memories that it brings.

Graves reception back at camp is not the most friendly, especially with Andacanavar who remembered the powrie from the attack on the barbarian ship in the first issue. Before things have a chance to escalate a sudden attack by frost giants brings the tension to an abrupt halt. Empowered by magic the giants steal the gemstones from an unsuspecting Abbot Greene, and decimate the ranks of the barbarians and monks. Grave Mungo is knocked unconscious, while Andacanavar, Moira, Byggvir, and Abbot Greene are all taken prisoner by the frost giants. When Grave awakes he is alone amongst a pile of corpses, and swears revenge on the giants.
name: Trial by Fire

volume.name: R.A. Salvatore's DemonWars: Trial by Fire

description:
CHAPTER 4

As Grave makes his way guided by the spirit of Elene he finally reaches the frost giant fortress, and truly realizes the strength of the forces arrayed against them. The giant tribes, once scattered across Alpinador, were now united under the giant king Thael who held a strong grudge against Byggvir and his people. In one of the fortress towers Elene is being prepared by the giant women for the ceremony to reincarnate the giants god, Managarm, the demon lord of war. To meet the requirements of the sacrifice, the giants need the blood of someone that has wronged them. The skull of a frost giant hanging on Byggvir's wall satisfied this rule since Elene was of the same blood as Byggvir.

Andacanavar awakens chained to a wall in the dungeons of the fortress along with his other companions. Using a magical amethyst that Andacanavar received as a gift from the elves, Moira is able to break the shackles binding them to the wall and escape the dungeon. They do not get far before they are spotted and attacked by several monsters. Amazingly, Abbot Greene and Byggvir work together to battle the giants while Andacanavar and Moira rush to save Elene. Meanwhile, Grave Mungo is raising a false alarm for wolves, and using the confusion to sneak inside the fortress.

Lord Thael, enveloped in hatred and revenge for the death of his wife and child, commences the ceremony to sacrifice the blood of Byggvir, and ressurect the demon lord Managarm. With a slash of his sword to Elene's arm, Lord Thael draws the blood to feed the fire for Managarms summoning. Using Elenes body, Managarm is unleashed upon the world to rain destruction upon their foes.
name: Trial By Fire

volume.name: R.A. Salvatore's DemonWars: Trial by Fire

description: Ally Or Spy? Far from his frozen northland home, barbarian Ranger Andacanavar tracks a friend's killer in the exotic land of Behren. His only lead is the fugitive harem girl Sagara, who may, in truth, be a deep cover spy. Hunting both is a demon djinn with the power to transform anyone's deepest desires into their darkest nightmares. The Crouching Tiger meets Arabian Nights action is fast and furious as the world once again trembles on the brink of a deadly DemonWar!
name: Eye for an Eye

description: The new DemonWar story continues! Andacanavar falls under the seductive sway of harem girl, Sagara, leaving the barbarian ranger vulnerable to the dark magics of a demon djinn! Now only Grave Mungo is in a position to save him?but the bloody redcap dwarf has an ax of his own to grind! Can't get enough of R.A. Salvatore's worlds of swords and sorcery? This DEMONWARS tale reveals a previously untold adventure!
name: Eye for an Eye

description: Continuing the DemonWars tale that reveals what happened before the novels! The barbarian ranger Andacanavar is tempted by what he wants most in life?but at what cost? Meanwhile, can Grave Mungo, Sagara, and Ketsuo defeat an army backed by the otherworldly power of a demon djinn?
name: Eye for an Eye

description: Concluding the DemonWars tale that reveals events from before the novels! When a murderer is revealed the barbarian ranger Andacanavar must choose between administering justice, or taking bloody revenge! Meanwhile, only Grave Mungo, Ketsuo and Sagara stand between Corona and an invasion of a dark djinn's demonic legions!
name: Eye for an Eye

description: The wait is over - everyone's favorite Bug is back, courtesy of the original AMBUSH BUG team of Keith Giffen and Robert Loren Fleming! Cities will be destroyed! Cats and dogs will live in sin! Every unanswered question of the DC Universe will be answered! Live heroes will die and dead heroes will live! Okay, none of that actually happens, but join us anyway for this totally irreverent romp through the DC Universe as only Ambush Bug could give you!
name: "Hey, You Sank My Battle-Ax!"

description:
Overview:

With the NEW AVENGERS and the MIGHTY AVENGERS trapped in the Savage Land, it's up to the AVENGERS INITIATIVE to face off against the first major strike of the Skrull Invasion! There, on the field of battle, the cadet with the biggest secret has to choose how red (or green) his blood really is. Heroes will fall. Heroes will die. And one shall rise. All THIS and: A new cowardly low for ANT-MAN! A new danger for WAR MACHINE! And 3-D MAN gains a "killer" new "krew"!

Homagecover to Avengers: The Initiative issue 1
name: The Only Good Skrull

description:
James Robinson's run on SUPERMAN continues as the battle for Metropolis between Superman and the long-vanished Atlas rages on. It's full-scale war, mano a mano, in the streets of the city.

Plus: the secret of where Atlas has been and how he ended up in the modern age is revealed! And if that weren't enough, who is the shadowy figure pulling the titan's strings?
name: The Coming of Atlas, Part 2: Time Lost

description:
Overview:

Rumble in the jungle, as the Black Panther squares off against the one foe hes never defeated: Killmonger. And the stakes have never been higher: Wakanda.
name: Back To Africa, Conclusion

description:
The 'Freshman Year' saga begins here! Travel back in time with this five-issue tale that takes Archie and his friends back to their very first year in high school. It all starts with this poignant prologue which finds the gang wondering just what that first year will be like, while reflecting fondly on the past as well. Along the way, the gang must deal with the pending departure of one of their closest friends, as well as their bickering parents. And while the kids count the days until they enter their new school home, someone else is joining Riverdale High, too: Principal Waldo Weatherbee!

All this, plus allusions to Captain Pureheart, The Man from R.I.V.E.R.D.A.L.E., Veronica's worldwide travels, and more! It's all brought to you by fan-favorite writer Batton Lash of Wolff & Byrd and Archie Meets the Punisher fame!
name: The Summer Before FRESHMAN YEAR, Part 1 of 5

description:
Anything you've ever wanted to know about the characters in INVINCIBLE, but were afraid to ask. Power levels, hometowns, relatives, origins, shoe sizes... it's all here. Written in the tradition of that other famous handbook and featuring drawings from some of the top talents in comics and animation. A MUST HAVE FOR ANY INVINCIBLE FAN!

Official Invincible Handbook containing profiles on characters listed from Allen the Alien to Komodo Dragon.
name: A-L - From Allen the Alien to Komodo Dragon

volume.name: The Official Handbook of the Invincible Universe

description:
In 2007, Top Cow unleashed First Born, hailed by critics as "a quality mini-series, required reading and an epic adventure." That storyline changed the Top Cow Universe forever. But that was just the beginning.Broken Trinity brings together the Witchblade, The Darkness and The Angelus once more, but this time the stakes are even higher as a new artifact is discovered, forever upsetting the balance of power. By the conclusion of the crossover, a major new player will be introduced into the Top Cow Universe, while at least one established character will be gone forever. The team of Marz and Sejic that dazzled you with First Born and their ongoing adventures on Witchblade is back to change the face of the Top Cow Universe one more time.

Also featuring part one of a stunning triptych variant cover by Dale Keown (Pitt).Broken Trinity #1 kicks off a three-issue limited series, augmented by three, stand-alone, tie-in issues for Witchblade, The Darkness and The Angelus.

Anything you've ever wanted to know about the characters in INVINCIBLE but were afraid to ask. Power levels, hometowns, relatives, origins, shoe sizes... it's all here. Written in the tradition of that other famous handbook and featuring drawings from some of the top talents in comics and animation. A MUST HAVE FOR ANY INVINCIBLE FAN!

Official Invincible Handbook containing profiles on characters listed from Kursk to Winslow, B.N.
name: K-W - Kursk to Winslow, B.N.

volume.name: The Official Handbook of the Invincible Universe

description:
Overview:

Part 3 of "Cruel and Unusual" with special guest co-writer Greg Rucka joining the acclaimed DD creative team! Daredevil and Dakota North have investigated all angles of the brutal murders that Big Ben Donovan sits on Death Row for, and all they've come up with is more questions and conspiracies. Why does Big Ben want to be executed for a crime he probably didn't commit? And why does the government want Dakota and Matt Murdock off the case? Find out these answers and more!
name: Cruel & Unusual, Part Three of Four

description: If you've been wondering what comes next after MARK MILLAR's groundbreaking runs on ULTIMATES and ULTIMATES 2, then wonder no more - this is it! The mind that reinvented superheroes for the 21st Century joins forces with one of comicdom's best artists to chart a new courses for superhero action in a series that will definitely be one of the talked about of the year!
name: The Long War

description: Welcome to Paranoia. It's the New Warriors vs the New Warriors. When you cannot trust in your oldest friend or even you team leader, when there's no trust in the man next to you, maybe you're already defeated and you still are not aware of that.
name: Invaded, Part 1

description: It's all fun and games when Ben tells a group of schoolchildren a rather fanciful account of a battle against the Rhino, but when the real life Abomination shows up, things turn deadly serious for the Fantastic Four.
name: It's Storytellin' Time

description: Ahh, Reed Richards. Ever absent-minded. When the Fantastic Four helps to raise money for a block renovation, Reed runs an "I'll fix anything!" booth, and in between putting booster rockets on mopeds and laser cannons in wristwatches, he sort of, you know, accidentally fixes the Mad Thinker's android. Oops. Now it's the Mad Thinker and his Awesome Android versus the Fantastic Four and some toasters. Yeah, I said toasters.
name: The (Mr.) Fantastic Fix-It Shoppe!

description: A MODEL DAY: 75% of the Fantastic Four positively agree that it's GREAT to judge an international beauty pageant, but what's Sue to do during the festivities? Well, how about unearthing that the pageant is actually sponsored by A.I.M. in order to smuggle high tech battle robots into the country? Or how about teaming up with a certain long lost model from Marvel's past, and then picking a fight with those battle robots? Yeah, Sue keeps busy in this one.
name: Go One Way ORRGO Another

description: ALTERNATIVE FILM SCHOOL: The Fantastic Four help out a college film professor by volunteering their time for his top students. Want the FF to star in your disco film? No problem. Want the FF to headline your Jane Austen-influenced romantic comedy? Sure! That can be arranged. Want to use your anti-matter powered film projector to transform a group of cos-players into evil (though quite amateur) versions of some of Marveldom's mightiest heroes and villains, all in a bid to destroy the FF and take over the world? Uhh---now we got a problem...
name: Understudy Rumble

description:
Overview:

SECRET INVASION tie-in and X-FACTOR crossover issue! Its double the trouble as our gamma-ray glamazon finds herself on a collision course with the mystery-solving X-Factor and hip-deep in the Skrull infestation! What does She-Hulks partner Jazinda who just happens to be a Skrull know about the invasionand is she part of it? And why has writer Peter David pitted the heroes of his two books against one another? All the answers are waiting for you hereand so is an exciting new art team!
name: He Loves You, Part 2 of 3

description:
Overview:

Sinisters machinations finally come to a head, after decades of preparations. Can Xavier discover the secrets to the plot against his mind before his loses his sanity? Or will he become another in a long line of victims? Either way, he just may learn things about his past hell come to regret. Guest starring Sebastian Shaw and the deadliest gator in the swamp, Gambit!
name: Sins Of The Father, Part 4

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: Vertigo's most skin-crawling series crashes to an apocalyptic conclusion as the boys (and girls) of Bug Bee Gone fight the battle they always knew was coming: humanity's last stand against the chaos of nature. There's no guarantee that anyone will survive, but if Henry, Stretch, Nils and the rest can't make a last stand against the killer cockroaches, no one else will. Don't miss the ending of this cult-classic comic never to be duplicated.
name: Bug Brothers Forever- Conclusion

description: Part 1 of "Bug Brothers Forever." The bug-god Atan (returned to Earth in the form of Henry's depraved ex-partner AJ) and his army of Mayan Hissers begin a massive attack. They need one last key to open the mysterious box and the Bug Bee Gone boys have got it. As the Hissers lay waste to Los Angeles, Henry, Stretch and the crew steel themselves for what could be their final, heroic stand.
name: Bug Brothers Forever - Chapter One

description: And what secret does death hold for the Paladins, heroes considered a "lost generation" by everyone but them? The answers edge the WildStorm Universe ever closer to oblivion!
name: Verse Five: This is How the World Ends

description: The End of Days has come to the WildStorm Universe, as the Paladins fight for their city's very existence against the coming destruction. But when the riders of the Apocalypse appear is the end truly at hand? And what role does the newly returned hero from WildStorm's past play in the bigger picture: will he be their savior or their doom?
name: Verse Four: Horses

description: Make Way For A Better World (Batman, Superman)
name: Make Way for a Better World

description:
1. Karkan the Mighty -- Lord of the Jungle! (an imaginary Super Baby story / written by Leo Dorfman)

2. War of the Wraith-Mates! (Legion of Super-Heroes / written by Cary Bates : reprinted in: Legion of Super-Heroes Archives #10)

3. Gravity Girl of Smallville! (Superboy, Lana Lang, Ma Kent, Krypto, Lewis Lang, Mrs. Lang / written by Robert Bernstein : reprinted from: Adventure Comics #285)
name: Karkan the Mighty -- Lord of the Jungle! ; War of the Wraith-Mates! ; Gravity Girl of Smallville!

description:
1. Cover by Nick Cardy.
  2. "Olsen the Red Last of the Vikings" written by Leo Dorfman, penciled by Kurt Schaffenberger and inked by Vince Colletta. (Jimmy Olsen, Superman, Meg Tempest)
  3. "The Girl who was Made of Money" written by Leo Dorfman, penciled by Kurt Schaffenberger and inked by Vince Colletta. (Jimmy Olsen, Superman, Morgan Edge)
name: Olsen the Red Last of the Vikings / The Girl who was Made of Money

description:
1. Cover by Nick Cardy.
  2. "The Downfall of Judas Olsen" written by Leo Dorfman, penciled by Kurt Schaffenberger and inked by Vince Colletta. (Jimmy Olsen as Mr. Action, Terry Dean, Superman, Morgan Edge)
  3. "A Coffin for Mr. Action" written by Leo Dorfman, penciled by Kurt Schaffenberger and inked by Vince Colletta. (Jimmy Olsen as Mr. Action, Superman)
  4. Kurt Schaffenberger Biography full text piece in the Jimmy Olsen's Pen-Pals letter column.
name: The Downfall of Judas Olsen / A Coffin for Mr. Action

description: The mysterious Ruse reveals his true identity, only to leave Medusa with a stone cold choice that forces her to decide between love or death with the fate of the Ancient Gods in the balance! Don't miss the stunning conclusion to this acclaimed miniseries!

The third installment of the prequel horror series to Electronic Arts' upcoming sci-fi survival horror game, illustrated by top-tier talent BEN TEMPLESMITH (FELL, 30 Days of Night) and written by ANTONY JOHNSTON (Wasteland)! The mysterious artifact is finally excavated at the Aegis VII mining colony. Theories about its true purpose spread like wildfire, and hint of a terrible fate for the colonists.

Continuing the prequel horror series to Electronic Arts' upcoming deep space survival horror game, illustrated by top-tier talent BEN TEMPLESMITH (30 Days of Night) and written by ANTONY JOHNSTON (Wasteland)! The planet cracker ship Ishimura arrives in orbit, bringing with it even more problems for a mining colony already rapidly descending into madness. And when the operation finally 'pops the cork' on the planet, all hell breaks loose!

REAL SPACE. REAL TERROR. Continuing the prequel horror series to Electronic Arts' upcoming deep space survival horror game, illustrated by top-tier talent BEN TEMPLESMITH (30 Days of Night) and written by ANTONY JOHNSTON (Wasteland)! The infection has begun! The colonists of Aegis VII begin a desperate fight for survival in the face of the necromorph onslaught, as the true scope of their fate becomes clear. Can anyone escape before the colony is overrun?

1. Treeing Off (Donald, Huey, Dewey, and Louie)

2. A Christmas for Shacktown (Donald, his nephews, Daisy, Uncle Scrooge, Gladstone Gander)

3. Christmas Kiss (Donald and Daisy Duck)

4. A Stamp Sized Christmas List (Donald and his 3 nephews)
name: Walt Disney's Donald Duck in A Christmas for Shacktown

description: INVASION SQUID FORCE! Finally the mystery of the meteor is revealed... but what exactly has happened to Information Agent Hip Flask?
name: Worlds Collide

description:
1. Meet the Planet People (inside front cover)

2. The Prisoner of the Tharks (written by Gaylord DuBois)

3. Creatures of Mars (inside back cover)

4. [Pin-up on back cover]

This issue was reprinted in: John Carter of Mars #1 (Gold Key)
name: Edgar Rice Burroughs' John Carter of Mars

description:
Overview:

New costume! New beginning! New home! New Partner! Everything is all-new starting with this issue. Featuring an all-new cover by comic book super-star JIM LEE! If youve ever thought about reading INVINCIBLE this is the jumping-on point youve been waiting for. The next fifty issues start here!

1. Shooting Gallery (inside front cover)

2. Secret Message to Hangri-La

3. The Painters

4. Rainy-Day Experiment
name: Andy Panda

description:
Overview:

Celebrate the return of Nocturnals with three rings of savagery in NOCTURNALS: CARNIVAL OF BEASTS. In the fully painted Beasts, Doc Horror unleashes an inner demon while settling an old score with a vipers nest of disturbed scientists. The Scrimshaw Crown follows amphibian girl, Starfish, tracking a haunted sea monster. In Candy Butchers, Halloween Girl, the Gunwitch and Polychrome encounter toothsome carnies.
name: Beasts; The Scrimshaw Crown; Candy Butchers

description:
Overview:

Are there angels in America's corn belt? That's what Proof's going to find out. Meanwhile, Ginger Brown returns to New York where she meets a golem. Again.
name: Thunderbirds Are Go!, Part One

description: The ratings are through the roof and the critics have labeled it a smash hit! And it's all leading up to the big showdown: Youngblood vs. Mayhem, Inc! Head-to-head combat! Who lives? Who dies? And who's sponsoring the whole thing? Celebrity superheroes like you've never seen them before! Plus, the return of a hero and a messenger from beyond the stars!

Multiple 3 Stories in this Issue:

  1. The Stage of Death (guest-starring: Captain America)
  2. Invasion Mission (guest-starring: Captain America)
  3. The Mad Mole's Folly (guest-starring: The Human Torch)

Plus 2 notes in this issue:

  1. Captain America Badges Have Gone to War (War stamp advertisement.)
  2. Wake Up Americans - signed Martin Goodman Publisher for War Stamps advertisement with Captain America

Let's Play Detective - writing from Allen Bellman

Greedy Grab -
name: The Cult of the Assassins

description: Midnight's campaign of terror continues, as the mysterious villains brings Clayface into the fold.
name: Mud Pies at Midnight!

description: Some geek is behind the murder of some Suicide Girls and Chris had no better idea than suggesting Cassie to become a SG to investigate the crimes. Lucky for us.
name: Hack/Slash Annual - Suicide Girls Annual

description:
Story Titles

  • Wonder Woman in "Darkness Fallen"
  • Green Arrow in "The Longshot"
  • SHAZAM! in "The Great Divide"
  • Superboy in "Glug-Glug Ka-Pow!"
  • Legion of Super-Heroes in "Team Work"
  • Supergirl in "Child Labor"
  • Tales of the Bizarro World in "Bizarro Must Think"
name: 80 Page Giant

description: Taking a long-deserved break from protecting the galaxy, a group of Legionnaires find themselves on a world where it's always summer, and the rule is rest and relaxation. But some members have other reasons for going, particularly Element Lad, whose quest to find a master criminal is the focus of an issue full of sun, fun and mystery-solving!
name: Endless Summer

description: The battle against the menace of the Blight heats up in Part 2 of the 4-part "Legion of the Damned!" After being stranded in space for a month, Cosmic Boy, Monstress, Apparition, and Brainiac 5.1 return to Earth and find the planet completely dominated by the alien race known as the Blight. Along with Chameleon, the remaining Legionnaires make a plan to storm the Blight headquarters, in the hopes of freeing their teammates ? and the rest of the planet ? from the Blight's control!
name: Legion of the Damned, Part Two: Damned If We Do!

description: Final issue. The aftermath of "Legion of the Damned" leads to dramatic changes for the Legion! What was once the mode of intergalactic travel may become the mode of intergalactic disaster, as the Stargate network has been corrupted by the Blight invasion! Plus, as the United Planets votes on whether or not the Legion should continue to exist, Leland McCauley adds fuel to the U.P.'s concerns about having teenagers protect the galaxy and introduces his all-new, all-adult WorkForce!
name: Widening Rifts part 2: Event Horizon

description: DEFEND YOUR LIBERTY! The Comic Book Legal Defense Fund and Image Comics defend your freedom of speech with LIBERTY COMICS, an all-new 32-page, full color comic book crammed cover-to-cover with work by many of todays top creative talents. This mature readers anthology is printed in a high quality format and features all-new stories of THE BOYS and CRIMINAL as well as all-new creations from some of your favorite artists. All proceeds benefit the CBLDF and their efforts to protect your creative rights!
name: Big 1st Amendment issue!
A Connecticut Yankee in King Author's Court

description:
Contains the reimaged stories of:

  • The Raven - by Poe
  • The Sleeper - by Poe
  • The Conqueror worm - by Poe
name: [Untitled]

volume.name: Haunt of Horror: Edgar Allan Poe

description:
Contains the reimaged stories and prose of:

  • The Tell Tale Heart - by Poe
  • Spirits of the Dead - by Poe
  • The Lake (The Lake - to-) - by Poe
  • Eulalie - by Poe
name: [Untitled]

volume.name: Haunt of Horror: Edgar Allan Poe

description:
Overview

Horror comics legend Richard Corben (Creepy, Eerie) and long-time collaborator Rich Margopoulos leave no gravestone unturned in this 3-issue limited series that offers wicked spins on the classic poems of Edgar Allen Poe. Each issue features three adaptations -- lovingly rendered in B&W with gray tones as only Corben can do it -- along with the full text of Poe's poem for comparison. In issue #3: "Berenice," "The Happiest Day," and "Israfel."
name: [Untitled]

volume.name: Haunt of Horror: Edgar Allan Poe
